title: Chef ‘who murdered wife and children also threatened to kill sister-in-law’
text:
Mohammed Shakur is accused of first murdering Juli Begum, then his daughters to cover his tracks (Picture: Central News)

A chef accused of murdering his wife and children threatened to kill his sister-in-law if she went to the police, a court heard.

Mohammed Abdul Shakur, 46, had a history of violence towards 26-year-old Juli Begum after their arranged marriage when she was just 19.

The Old Bailey heard the couple had been estranged since he attacked Ms Begum while she was seven months pregnant in 2001.

Shakur is said to have smothered her at her three-bedroom home in East Ham, east London, on New Year’s Day 2007.

He also murdered his two daughters, Anika, five, and Thanha, six, fearing they would identify him, jurors have been told.

Jurors heard Anika (front) was strangled with a white sock and Thana was bludgeoned to her face and head (Picture: Central News)

The pair married in October 1999 and Ms Begum sponsored Shakur a year later allowing him to join her in the UK before they moved into a house in Poplar.

Advertisement

Advertisement

But the relationship had soured by 2003 following a string of rows about his financial contributions to the family as well as his immigration status.

Jurors heard he shouted at his wife: ‘If you don’t correct my visa and you don’t make me legal to stay in this country then I will kill you and kill your whole family.’

Prosecutor David Spens QC told them: ‘It is the prosecution’s case that what caused the defendant to kill his wife is most likely to have been an argument about one or both of these issues.’

Shakur fled to Bangladesh days later, eventually finding himself in the same village his deceased wife’s sister lived in, the court heard.

When their paths crossed near her home, he allegedly delivered a similar threat: ‘Don’t tell the police I murdered your sister. If you tell the police I will murder you and your children.’

Shakur remained at large for a decade before being brought back to Britain to face trial for the three murders.

Police discovered the bodies on January 10 following calls from Ms Begum’s concerned relatives.

They found the body of 4ft 8in Ms Begum under a bed cover with Anika lying across her and Thanha beside the bed.

Anika had been strangled with a white sock bound tightly around her neck, the court heard.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Jurors were told that bruising on each side of her face indicated she had been ‘stunned’ by a blow before she was killed.

Thanha died from a severe head injury, having suffered blows to her face and head causing skull fractures, the court heard.

She could have survived for up to 30 minutes as she bled out on the carpet, it was claimed.

No fatal injuries were found on Ms Begum’s body, leading to the conclusion she may have been smothered with a soft pillow or cushion, the court heard.

The absence of any fatal wounds to Ms Begum indicates she was likely smothered, jurors heard (Picture: Central News)

Police found no sign of Ms Begum’s 22-carat gold necklaces, earrings and bangles worth £15,000 or her gold wedding set, the court heard.

Mr Spens took jurors through a catalogue of alleged domestic violence incidents Ms Begum had suffered at Shakur’s hands in the past.

In June 2001, Shakur lost his temper, grabbed her neck and scratched Thanha, who was then aged just 10 months, it was claimed.

She said the violence was sparked when Shakur lost his passport ahead of the imminent expiry of his leave to remain in the country.

Within days, police were called back to her home, the court heard.

Shakur was said to have grabbed seven months pregnant Ms Begum and pushed her against the wall.

Advertisement

He was forced out of the house having threatened to kill everyone in there and smash the windows, jurors were told.

Mr Spens said: ‘These were not isolated incidents but showed a pattern of aggressive behaviour in June 2001 towards his wife and on one occasion with complete disregard for the presence of Thanha, who ended up being scratched, whilst using violence against Juli.’

Shakur denies three counts of murder and the trial continues.

description: Mohammed Shakur is said to have murdered estranged wife Juli Begum as well as their two daughters before fleeing to Bangladesh.
